revised_title: Hans Sloane's Accounts of the Serpent-Stone and Rhinoceros Bezoar
tldr: In this letter, Sir Hans Sloane discusses two stones said to be found in the head of the venomous Cobra de Cabelos snake and in the stomach of the Rhinoceros. He also provides an account of the Rhinoceros Bezoar, which was believed to have medicinal properties. Sloane shares his findings and observations on these stones, their origins, and their uses.
